entry.title: Training Agenda netsuite-CarlZeng
entry.content:
2008-12-12Agenda Topics - Day OneWelcomeCourse objectivesTopics and Agenda for entire courseNavigating the ApplicationLogging into NetSuiteGetting around the applicationLists vs. Transactions vs. Setuâ€¦

2008-12-12

Agenda Topics - Day One

Welcome

  • Course objectives
  • Topics and Agenda for entire course

Navigating the Application

  • Logging into NetSuite
  • Getting around the application
  • Lists vs. Transactions vs. Setup Menus
  • Using help
  • Global & Quick search
  • Setting Personal Preferences

Break

Navigating the Application continuedâ€¦

  • Customizing your Home Dashboard
  • Direct List Editing
  • Tips & Tricks

NetSuite Users and Roles

  • Users & Roles overview
  • Customizing roles in NetSuite
  • Assigning roles (giving access)
  • Dashboards are based on the role type
  • Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Lunch and Break

Managing Your Activities and Calendar

  • Calendar overview
  • Activities definition
  • Setting calendar preferences
  • Event Scheduler
  • Phone Calls, Tasks & Events
  • Creating activities from entity & transaction records
  • The full circle: the activities sub tab on entity records
  • Outlook Integration - high level overview

General Ledge

Â· Creating journal entries

Â· Journal entry approval

Â· Viewing the G/L impact of transactions

Â· Creating memorized transactions

Â· Enter memorized transactions

Â· Financial reporting

Â· Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Accounts Payable

  • Accounts Payable overview
  • Billing purchase orders
  • Entering a bill directly
  • Paying bills in NetSuite
  • Entering vendor credits

Break

Accounts Receivable

  • Invoice to Payment process
    • Billing sales orders
    • Entering a New Cash Sale (no fulfillment)
    • Entering a New Invoice (no fulfillment)
    • Record customer deposits
    • Accept customer payments
  • Generating customer statements
  • Issue customer credit memos
  • Issue customer refunds
  • Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Purchasing

  • Purchasing overview
  • Review accounting preferences for purchasing
  • Enter a purchase order
  • Receive items from a purchase order
  • Partial receipts
  • Order Items screen
  • Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Agenda Topics - Day Two

Inventory Management

Â· Multi-location inventory

Â· Volume Pricing for Multiple Units of Measure

Â· Re-order point Reminders

Â· Inventory Adjustment

Â· Inventory Transfer

Â· Receive Purchase Order

Â· Fulfill Sales Orders

Â· Create Current Inventory Status Report

Â· Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Sales Order

  • Sales order management overview
    • Sales order transactions (to invoice, to cash sale)
    • Sales order forms (standard, invoice, cash sale)
    • Types of fulfillment
  • Enable order management features
  • Order management process:
    • Enter a sales order
    • Approve sales orders
    • Fulfill sales orders
    • Partial fulfillment

Â· Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Break

Sales Force Automation

  • SFA overview
  • Setting up Sales Force Automation
    • Enable features for SFA
    • Create customer statuses
    • Set sales preferences
    • Setup employees as sales reps
    • Create sales rules
    • Create sales territories
    • Create online customer forms (online leads)

Lunch and Break

Sales Force Automation continuedâ€¦

  • Day-to-day Sales Force Automation Processing:
    • Enter a lead
    • Locate and view leads (and leads list)
    • Creating opportunity records
    • Generating and emailing quotes/estimates
    • Converting quote/estimate to a sales order
    • Reporting

Â· Student Exercises (15 minutes)

Marketing Automation

  • Marketing campaign overview
  • Setup Marketing Automation:
    • Enable features
    • Authenticate campaign email addresses
    • Setup marketing preferences
  • Create & Manage Marketing Campaign Emails
    • Create marketing groups
    • Create campaign email template
    • Create and schedule the campaign

Break

Special Point One

Â· sales item configuration,

Â· customer database configuration,

Â· accounts (for bookkeeping) configuration

Â·

Special Point Two

Â· customizing forms for sales contract,

Â· customizing forms for delivery slip,

Â· customizing forms for quotes

Â· customizing forms for invoices

Summary and Conclusion

/* ncBGP_WriteToLog - utility function to write to the Background Process Manager log table
*
* This function will create a new NC Process Log record using the details provided
*
* Parameters:
* ProcessId - the id of the current process record
* RecordRef - a reference for the current record being processed or which the message relates to
* MessageText - the message text to be written to the log
* MessageType - the type of message, â€˜Errorâ€™, â€˜Warningâ€™ or â€˜Messageâ€™
*/
function ncBGP_WriteToLog(ProcessId,RecordRef,MessageText,MessageType)
{
var l_MsgType;
switch (MessageType)
{
case â€˜Errorâ€™:
l_MsgType = 1;
break;

case â€˜Warningâ€™:
l_MsgType = 2;
break;

case â€˜Messageâ€™:
default:
l_MsgType = 3;
}

var LogRec = nlapiCreateRecord(â€˜customrecord_ncbgp_processlogâ€™);
LogRec.setFieldValue(â€˜custrecord_logprocessidâ€™,ProcessId);
LogRec.setFieldValue(â€˜custrecord_logrecordrefâ€™,RecordRef);
LogRec.setFieldValue(â€˜custrecord_logmessagetypeâ€™,l_MsgType);
LogRec.setFieldValue(â€˜custrecord_logmessagedetailâ€™,MessageText);
nlapiSubmitRecord(LogRec,false);
}

function appendFormDataToURL(url,omit) {
var footer = document.getElementById(â€˜div__footerâ€™);
var elem, frm = parent.document.forms[â€˜footer_actionsâ€™];
if (isValEmpty(url)) url = â€˜â€™
for (var i = 0; i < frm.elements.length; i++) {
elem = frm.elements[i];
if (elem.name.length == 0 || elem.name == omit || elem.name.indexOf(â€˜inpt_â€˜) == 0) continue;
if (elem.type==â€™select-oneâ€™)
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, escape(parent.getSelectValue(elem)));
else if (isMultiSelect(elem))
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, escape(getMultiSelectValues(elem)));
else if (elem.type==â€™radioâ€™)
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, escape(getRadioValue(elem)));
else if (elem.type==â€™checkboxâ€™)
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, (elem.checked ? â€˜Tâ€™ : â€˜Fâ€™));
else if (elem.type==â€™textâ€™)
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, escape(elem.value));
else if (elem.type==â€™hiddenâ€™ && elem.name != â€˜frameâ€™)
url = addParamToURL(url, elem.name, encode(elem.value));
}
return url; }

Parameters

calculated per row

//ä¼ å…¥ä¸€ä¸ªtableçš„idï¼Œå°†tableçš„å…¨éƒ¨å†…å®¹å¯¼å‡ºexcelæ–‡ä»¶function AutomateExcel(objTable){// Start Excel and get Application object.var oXL = new ActiveXObject(â€œExcel.Applicationâ€);// Get a new workbook.var oWB = oXL.Workbâ€¦

//ä¼ å…¥ä¸€ä¸ªtableçš„idï¼Œå°†tableçš„å…¨éƒ¨å†…å®¹å¯¼å‡ºexcelæ–‡ä»¶
function AutomateExcel(objTable)
{
// Start Excel and get Application object.
var oXL = new ActiveXObject(â€œExcel.Applicationâ€);
// Get a new workbook.
var oWB = oXL.Workbooks.Add();
var oSheet = oWB.ActiveSheet;
var hang = objTable.rows.length;

var lie = objTable.rows(0).cells.length;

// Add table headers going cell by cell.
for (var i=0;i<hang;i++)
{
for (var j=0;j<lie;j++)
{
oSheet.Cells(i+1,j+1).value = objTable.rows(i).cells(j).innerText;
}

}
oXL.Visible = true;
oXL.UserControl = true;
}

//æè¿°ï¼šå°†å›ºå®šæ ¼å¼çš„xmlæ–‡ä»¶å¯¼å‡ºexcelæ–‡ä»¶
//strXmlï¼šä¼ å…¥çš„xmlå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œä¸€èˆ¬ä¸ºdatasetç›´æ¥getxmlå¾—åˆ°çš„å°±å¯ä»¥ï¼›
//xmlFieldï¼šè¦å¯¼å…¥çš„å­—æ®µå’Œå¯¹åº”çš„ä¸­æ–‡åç§°ï¼Œæ ¼å¼å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š
//var xmlField=â€& lt;FIELDLIST>ä¸»é¢˜å…³é”®è¯< /KEYWORD>æŠ¥é¢˜æ¥æº<CREATE_DATE>åˆ›å»ºæ—¥æœŸ< /CREATE_DATE><COLUMN_NAME>æ‰€å±æ ç›®</COLUMN_NAME>< /FIELDLIST>â€;
function ExpXmlToExcel(strXml,xmlField)
{
//å¯¼å…¥xmlå­—ç¬¦ä¸²
var xmlDoc = new XmlDoc();
xmlDoc.loadXML(strXml);
var nodesList = xmlDoc.documentElement.childNodes;

//å¯¼å…¥å­—æ®µåˆ—è¡¨ï¼›
var xmlDocField = new XmlDoc();
xmlDocField.loadXML(xmlField);
var fieldList = xmlDocField.documentElement.childNodes;

// Start Excel and get Application object.
var oXL = new ActiveXObject(â€œExcel.Applicationâ€);
// Get a new workbook.
var oWB = oXL.Workbooks.Add();
var oSheet = oWB.ActiveSheet;
var hang = nodesList.length;
var lie = fieldList.length;
//æ’å…¥è¡¨å¤´

for (var j=0;j<lie;j++)
{
oSheet.Cells(1,j+1).value =fieldList[j].text;
}

// Add table headers going cell by cell.
for (var i=0;i<hang;i++)
{
for (var j=0;j<lie;j++)
{
oSheet.Cells(i+2,j+1).value = nodesList[i].selectSingleNode(fieldList[j].nodeName).text;
}
}
oXL.Visible = true;
oXL.UserControl = true;
}

//æŒ‡å®šé¡µé¢åŒºåŸŸå†…å®¹å¯¼å…¥Word
//eDivï¼šè¦å¯¼å‡ºå…·ä½“å†…å®¹çš„div
function ExpHtmlToWord(eDiv)
{
var oWD = new ActiveXObject(â€œWord.Applicationâ€);
var oDC = oWD.Documents.Add(â€œâ€,0,1);
var oRange =oDC.Range(0,1);
var sel = document.body.createTextRange();

sel.moveToElementText(eDiv);
sel.select();
sel.execCommand(â€œCopyâ€);
oRange.Paste();
oWD.Application.Visible = true;
}

-â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”

var a = fso.CreateTextFile(â€œc:\\testfile.txtâ€, true);
a.WriteLine(â€œThis is a test.â€);
a.Close();

=======================================================================

ä¸¤ç§æ–¹æ¡ˆéƒ½å¯ä»¥å®ç°ï¼Œåœ¨netsuiteä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨nlapiPrintRecord(type, id, mode, properties)

Parameters
? type {string} [required] - Print operation type: TRANSACTION|STATMENT
? id {string} [required] - The internal ID of the transaction or statement being printed
? mode {string} [optional] - The output type: PDF|HTML|DEFAULT. DEFAULT uses
the user/company preference for print output
? properties {string} [optional] - Name/value pairs used to configure the print operation.
Currently only supported for STATEMENT. Note that even if type is set to
STATEMENT, properties is still an optional argument.
? STATEMENT: openonly (T|F), statementdate, startdate

Returns
? nlobjFile object

Example

function printTrans()
{
//print the transaction to a PDF file object
var file = nlapiPrintRecord(â€˜TRANSACTIONâ€™, 1799, â€˜DEFAULTâ€™, null);
//send the PDF as an attachment
nlapiSendEmail(â€˜-5â€™, â€˜test@totemsuite.com', â€˜Incoming Transactionâ€™, â€˜Please see attached transactionâ€™, null,
null, null, file);
}

This sample shows how to create a PDF of a particular transaction. First the file variable is set
to a PDF file object. This PDF is then returned as an nlobjResponse object. The response object
content type is set to PDF (using the nlobjFile.getType() method). Finally, the the output of
the response object is written to the server.
var file = nlapiPrintRecord(â€˜TRANSACTIONâ€™, 1799, â€˜PDFâ€™, null);
response.setContentType(file.getType());
response.write(file.getValue());

ç›´æ¥åœ¨æœåŠ¡ç«¯ç”Ÿæˆç›¸åº”çš„æ–‡ä»¶æ¥ç»™ç”¨æˆ·ä¸‹è½½ç­‰åŠ¨ä½œçš„æ€è·¯ï¼š

nlobjFile
Primary object used to encapsulate files (attachments). Note that the following functions
return a reference to this object:
? nlapiCreateFile(name, type, contents)//ç”¨æ¥åˆ›å»ºæ–‡ä»¶
? nlapiLoadFile(id)
? nlapiMergeRecord(id, baseType, baseId, altType, altId, fields)
? nlapiPrintRecord(type, id, mode, properties)
nlobjFile Methods
? â€œgetId()â€ on page 1
? â€œgetName()â€ on page 1
? â€œgetSize()â€ on page 1
? â€œgetType()â€ on page 1
? â€œgetURL()â€ on page 1
? â€œgetValue()â€ on page 1
? â€œsetName(name)â€ on page 1

nlapiCreateFile(name, type, contents) //æœåŠ¡ç«¯ä¸“ç”¨
Instantiates and returns an nlobjFile object.
Use this API to create ad-hoc, non-binary virtual files for use as email or fax attachments. Note
that ad-hoc attachments created using nlapiCreateFile are â€œvirtualâ€ documents/attachments
They are not actual file objects that can be stored in the NetSuite file cabinet.
The nlapiCreateFile API can also be used for streaming to clients (via Suitelets). For streaming
or attaching binary content, you can call the following:
? nlapiLoadRecord(type, id)
? nlapiPrintRecord(type, id, mode, properties)
? nlapiMergeRecord(id, baseType, baseId, altType, altId, fields)
Each of these APIs can load or generate binary content.
Important: nlapiCreateFile is a server-side-only function.
Parameters
? name {string} [required] - The name of the file
? type {string} [required] - The file type. For a list of supported file types, see Supported
File Types in the SuiteScript Reference Guide. Note that when specifiying the type for
an ad-hoc email or fax attachment, only non-binary types are supported (for example
PLAINTEXT, HTML, XML)
? contents {string} [required] - The contents of the file

function sendAttachment()
{
var newAttachment = nlapiCreateFile(â€˜helloworld.txtâ€™, â€˜PLAINTEXTâ€™, â€˜Hello World\nHello Worldâ€™);

var pdfcontents = nlapiMergeTemplate(â€¦..)
var fileObj = nlapiCreateFile(â€˜mypdf.pdfâ€™, â€˜PDFâ€™, pdfcontents)

Zach Nelson æ‰å…‹-å°¼å°”æ£® is comming..netsuiteä¸­å›½ http://www.totemsuite.comI will show him the most important Product Developed by TotemSuite(SuiteTalk).:Dear Respected Zach , Glad to see you, I am pleased toâ€¦

:Dear Respected Zach , Glad to see you, I am pleased to be able to introduce the solution provided by TotemSuite.I will show you in three Part . ok, letâ€™s begin?

function englishmoney(num){var i;var hundreds;var tenth;var one;var thousand;var million;var billion;var numbers;var svar result;if((num==â€™â€™)||(num==null)) return(â€˜â€™);var str;str= â€˜000000000000000000 â€¦

**function englishmoney(num){
var i;
var hundreds;
var tenth;
var one;
var thousand;
var million;
var billion;
var numbers;
var s
var result;

if((num==â€™â€™)||(num==null)) return(â€˜â€™);
var str;
str= â€˜000000000000000000 â€˜+num.toString();
numbers= â€˜one two three four five â€˜
+ â€˜six seven eight nine ten â€˜
+ â€˜eleven twelve thirteen fourteen fifteen â€˜
+ â€˜sixteen seventeen eighteen nineteen â€˜
+ â€˜twenty thirty forty fifty â€˜
+ â€˜sixty seventy eighty ninety â€˜;
String.prototype.Trim = function(){return this.replace(/^\s+|\s+$/g, â€œ â€œ);}
String.prototype.Ltrim = function(){return this.replace(/^\s+/g, â€œ â€œ);}
String.prototype.Rtrim = function(){return this.replace(/\s+$/g, â€œ â€œ);}
s=str.substring(str.length-15,str.length);
billion=parseInt(s.substring(0,3)); //å°†12ä½æ•´æ•°åˆ†æˆ4æ®µï¼šåäº¿ã€ç™¾ä¸‡ã€åƒã€ç™¾åä¸ª
million=parseInt(s.substring(3,6));
thousand=parseInt(s.substring(6,9));
result= â€˜ â€˜;
i=0;****
while(i <=3){
hundreds=parseInt(s.substring(i*3,i*3+1));//ç™¾ä½0-9
tenth=parseInt(s.substring(i*3+1,i*3+2));
if(tenth==1){one=10+parseInt(s.substring(i*3+2,i*3+3));}
else {one=0+parseInt(s.substring(i*3+2,i*3+3));}
// one=(CASE @tenth WHEN 1 THEN 10 ELSE 0 END)+CAST(SUBSTRING(@s,@i*3+3,1) AS int)â€“ä¸ªä½0-19
if(tenth <=1){tenth=0;}**

// tenth=(CASE WHEN @tenth <=1 THEN 0 ELSE @tenth END)â€“åä½0ã€2-9
if((i==1&&parseInt(billion)> 0&&(parseInt(million)> 0||parseInt(thousand)> 0||parseInt(hundreds)> 0))||
(i==2&&(parseInt(billion)> 0||parseInt(million)> 0)&&(parseInt(thousand)> 0||parseInt(hundreds)> 0))||
(i==3&&(parseInt(billion)> 0||parseInt(million)> 0||parseInt(thousand)> 0)&&(parseInt(hundreds)> 0)))
{result=result+ â€˜, â€˜;}//â€“ç™¾ä½ä¸æ˜¯0åˆ™æ¯æ®µä¹‹é—´åŠ è¿æ¥ç¬¦,

if(i==3 && (billion> 0 || million> 0 || thousand> 0) && (hundreds==0 && (tenth> 0 || one> 0)))
{result=result+ â€˜ and â€˜;}//â€“ç™¾ä½æ˜¯0åˆ™åŠ è¿æ¥ç¬¦AND

if(hundreds> 0)
{result=result+numbers.substring(hundreds*10-10,hundreds*10).Rtrim()+ â€˜ hundred â€˜;}

if( tenth>=2 && tenth <=9)
{
if(hundreds> 0)
{result=result+ â€˜ and â€˜;}
result=result+numbers.substring(tenth*10+170,tenth*10+180).Rtrim();
}

if(one>=1 && one <=19)
{
if(tenth> 0)
{result=result+ â€˜- â€˜;}
else
{
if(hundreds> 0){result=result+ â€˜ and â€˜;}
}
result=result+numbers.substring(one*10-10,one*10).Rtrim();
}

if(i==0 && parseInt(billion)> 0){
result=result+ â€˜ billion â€˜;}
if(i==1 && parseInt(million)> 0){
result=result+ â€˜ million â€˜;}
if(i==2 && parseInt(thousand)> 0){
result=result+ â€˜ thousand â€˜;}
i=i+1;
}
if(s.substring(13,15)!= â€˜00 â€˜){
result=result+ â€˜ Only â€˜;
if(s.substring(13,14)== â€˜0 â€˜){
result=result+ â€˜zero â€˜;}
else
{result=result+numbers.substring(parseInt(s.substring(13,14))*10-10,parseInt(s.substring(13,14))*10).Rtrim();}
if(s.substring(14,15)!= â€˜0 â€˜){
result=result+ â€˜ â€˜+numbers.substring(parseInt(s.substring(14,15))*10-10,parseInt(s.substring(14,15))*10).Rtrim();}
}

return(result);
}

ä»¥ä¸Šjså®ç° é˜¿æ‹‰ä¼¯æ•°å­—é‡‘é¢ è½¬æ¢ä¸ºè‹±æ–‡é‡‘é¢

entry.title: js fixå°æ•°ç‚¹ å’Œintçš„åŒºåˆ«-CarlZeng
entry.content:
num.Fixed(2) åŠŸèƒ½ï¼šå¯ä»¥å®šä¹‰ç²¾ç¡®åˆ°å¤šå°‘ä¸ºçš„å°æ•°ç‚¹ã€‚ Returns the integer portion of a number. Int(number) Fix(number) â€¦

num.Fixed(2)

åŠŸèƒ½ï¼šå¯ä»¥å®šä¹‰ç²¾ç¡®åˆ°å¤šå°‘ä¸ºçš„å°æ•°ç‚¹ã€‚

Returns the integer portion of a number.

Int(number) 

    **Fix(**number**)**

The number argument can be any valid numeric expression. If number contains Null, Null is returned.

Both Int and Fix remove the fractional part of number and return the resulting integer value.

The difference between Int and Fix is that if number is negative, Int returns the first negative integer less than or equal to number, whereas Fix returns the first negative integer greater than or equal to number. For example, Int converts -8.4 to -9, and Fix converts -8.4 to -8.

The following examples illustrate how the Int and Fix functions return integer portions of numbers:

Copy Code

MyNumber = Int(99.8) â€˜ Returns 99. 

    MyNumber = **Fix(**99.2**)**    ' Returns 99.                        MyNumber = **Int(**\-99.8**)**   ' Returns -100.                        MyNumber = **Fix(**\-99.8**)**   ' Returns -99.                        MyNumber = **Int(**\-99.2**)**   ' Returns -100.                        MyNumber = **Fix(**\-99.2**)**   ' Returns -99.

package org.bromon.test;

public class OnlineList implements HttpSessionAttributeListener
{
private static List list=new ArrayList();

public void attributeAdded(HttpSessionBindingEvent se)

{

{

public void attributeRemoved(HttpSessionBindingEvent se)

function Machine_addline(gonext)
1474{
1475
1476 if(this.isCurrentlySegmented)
1477 gonext = true;
1478
1479 if (!window.isinited) return false;
1480
1481 var linenum = parseInt( this.getMachineIndex() );
1482 var maxline = parseInt( this.getMaxIndex() );
1483 if (!this.allow_insert && maxline < linenum+1)
1484 {
1485 alert(â€œPlease choose a line to editâ€);
1486 return false;
1487 }
1488
1489 if (document.forms[â€˜main_formâ€™].elements.nlapiVL != null && !nlapiValidateLine(this.name))
1490 return false;
1491
1492 if (!this.validateline())
1493 return false;
1494
1495 var i;
1496 var fields = new Array();
1497 var labels = new Array();
1498 var allFieldsAreEmpty = true;
1499
1500 for ( i = 0; i < this.countFormElements() ; i++)
1501 {
1502 if ( (this.isElementRequired( i ) && this.isMandatoryOnThisLine(linenum,i) ) || (this.getFormElementType( i ) == â€œnamevaluelistâ€ && this.getFormElement( i ).value.length > 0))
1503 {
1504 fields[fields.length] = this.getFormElement( i );
1505 labels[labels.length] = this.getElementDisplayLabel( i );
1506 }
1507 // there are cases where machines have no mandatory fields. In this case you can hit the add button to add a row with no values.
1508 // this does not make sense, and complicates the back end a great deal. As long as we think all the fields are
1509 // empty, weâ€™ll check each field for a value
1510 if( allFieldsAreEmpty && !isempty( this.getFormElement( i ) ) )
1511 allFieldsAreEmpty = false;
1512 }
1513
1514 if ( fields.length > 0 )
1515 {
1516 var emptylabels = checkMandatoryFields(fields, labels);
1517 if ( emptylabels.length != 0 )
1518 {
1519 if (emptylabels.indexOf(â€œ,â€) != -1)
1520 alert(â€œPlease enter value(s) for: â€œ+emptylabels);
1521 else
1522 alert(â€œPlease enter a value for â€œ+emptylabels);
1523 return false;
1524 }
1525 }
1526
1527 // if all the fields are empty (a machine can have no mandatory fields) there is no point in adding the row
1528 if ( allFieldsAreEmpty )
1529 {
1530 alert(â€œPlease enter a value into at least one field before adding the row.â€);
1531 return false;
1532 }
1533
1534 if (this.uniquefield != null && !this.checkunique())
1535 return false;
1536
1537
1538 this.updateLineData();
1539
1540 if (this.preferredfield != null && getEncodedValue(this.name,linenum,this.preferredfield) == â€˜Tâ€™)
1541 this.setPreferredValue(linenum);
1542 this.recalc();
1543 this.isinserting = false;
1544
1545 if (gonext == true && linenum < this.getNextIndex()-1)
1546 {
1547 this.ischanged=false;
1548 this.viewline(linenum+1)
1549 this.postprocessline(linenum);
1550 }
1551 else
1552 {
1553 this.clearline(false);
1554 this.postprocessline(linenum);
1555 this.getsyncline( linenum - 1);
1556 }
1557 return true;
1558}

function Machine_updateLineData( )
1563{
1564
1565 var linenum = parseInt( this.getMachineIndex() );
1566 var formElems = this.countFormElements();
1567 var linedata = new Array();
1568 for (var i=0; i < formElems; i++)
1569 {
1570 var curType = this.getFormElementType( i );
1571 var curName = this.getFormElementName( i );
1572 var curElement = this.getFormElement( i );
1573
1574 if ( curType == â€œselectâ€ || curType == â€œslaveselectâ€ )
1575 {
1576 if (isMultiSelect( curElement ) || isPopupMultiSelect( curElement ))
1577 {
1578 linedata[i] = getMultiSelectValues( curElement );
1579 }
1580 else
1581 {
1582 linedata[i] = getSelectValue( curElement );
1583 }
1584 }
1585 else if ( curType == â€œcheckboxâ€ )
1586 {
1587 linedata[i] = curElement.checked ? â€œTâ€ : â€œFâ€;
1588 }
1589 else if ( curType == â€œradioâ€ )
1590 {
1591 for (var j=0; j < curElement.length; j++)
1592 if ( curElement[j].checked)
1593 linedata[i] = curElement[j].value;
1594 }
1595 else if ((curType == â€œtextâ€ || curType == â€œtextareaâ€) && this.isElementPopupDisplayField(i)
1596 && i < this.countFormElements()-1
1597 && (this.getFormElementType( i+1 ) == â€œintegerâ€ || this.getFormElementType( i+1 ) == â€œslaveselectâ€)
1598 && this.getFormElement( i+1 ).value.length == 0)
1599 {
1600 linedata[i] = â€˜â€™;
1601 }
1602 else if ( curType == â€œaddressâ€ || curType == â€œtextareaâ€)
1603 {
1604 linedata[i] = curElement.value.replace(/ /g,â€™â€™).replace(/ /g,String.fromCharCode(5));
1605 }
1606 else if (curType == â€˜fieldset_inlineâ€™)
1607 {
1608 linedata[i] = getInlineTextValue(document.getElementById(this.getFormElementName(i)+â€_valâ€));
1609 }
1610 else if (curType != â€œfieldsetâ€)
1611 {
1612 linedata[i] = curElement.value;
1613 }
1614
1615 if (curElement != null && this.getFormElementFieldSet(i).length > 0)
1616 {
1617 var spanName = (curName.indexOf( â€˜_displayâ€™ ) == -1 ? curName : this.getFormElementName( i+1 )) + â€˜_fsâ€™;
1618 var spanObj = document.getElementById( spanName );
1619 if (spanObj != null && spanObj.style.display == â€˜noneâ€™)
1620 {
1621 linedata[i] = â€œâ€;
1622 }
1623 }
1624
1625
1626 if (linedata[i] != null)
1627 {
1628 var regExp = new RegExp(â€œ[â€œ + String.fromCharCode(1) + String.fromCharCode(2) + â€œ]â€œ, â€œgâ€);
1629
1630 linedata[i] = new String(linedata[i]).replace(regExp,â€™.â€™);
1631 }
1632
1633 if ( window.virtualBrowser )
1634 {
1635 setEncodedValue(this.name, linenum, curName, linedata[i] != null ? linedata[i] : â€˜â€™)
1636 }
1637 }
1638
1639
1640 var linearray2 = getLineArray( this.name );
1641
1642 var olddata = this.getMainFormData();
1643 var linearray = (olddata.length == 0 ? new Array() : linearray2);
1644
1645 var maxline = parseInt( this.getNextIndex() );
1646 if (maxline < linenum+1)
1647 {
1648 this.setIndex( (linenum+1).toString() );
1649 linearray[linearray.length] = â€œâ€;
1650 }
1651
1652 linearray = (linearray.slice(0,linenum-1).concat(linedata.join(String.fromCharCode(1)))).concat(linearray.slice(linenum));
1653 this.setMainFormData( linearray.join(String.fromCharCode(2)) );
1654 clearLineArray(this.name);
1655}

entry.title: l_sort functionæ˜ç»† netsuiteåˆ—æ’åº-CarlZeng
entry.content:
function l_sort(col,coltype,hier,hiercol,mach,colname,sAlternateSortType)153{154 // this is used in cases where a column needs to be sorted by something different than itâ€™s type/value155 if(sAlternâ€¦

function l_sort(col,coltype,hier,hiercol,mach,colname,sAlternateSortType)

153{

154 // this is used in cases where a column needs to be sorted by something different than itâ€™s type/value

155 if(sAlternateSortType != null)

156 coltype = sAlternateSortType;

157 var i = 0, node,node2, numRows = 0, rnode, col2 = -1, col2type;

158 var elems = new Array(), elem, cols;

159 var dir_up = true, dir_up2;

160 var ordered_mach = false;

161 if (mach == â€˜â€™ || mach == null) mach = â€˜â€™;

162 else if (document.forms[0].elements[mach+â€™sortidxâ€™] != null)

163 {

164 col2 = document.forms[0].elements[mach+â€™sortidxâ€™].value;

165 if (col2 == col)

166 col2 = -1;

167 else

168 {

169 col2type = document.forms[0].elements[mach+â€™sorttypeâ€™].value;

170 dir_up2 = document.forms[0].elements[mach+â€™sortdirâ€™].value == â€œUPâ€;

171 }

172 ordered_mach = hasEncodedField(mach,mach+â€seqnumâ€);

173 }

174

175 node = l_id(mach+â€™dirâ€™+col);

176 if (node.src.indexOf(â€˜nlup.gifâ€™) != -1)

177 dir_up = false;

178 node.src = dir_up ? â€˜/images/nav/nlup.gifâ€™ : â€˜/images/nav/nldown.gifâ€™;

179 node2 = l_id(mach+â€™headerâ€™);

180 for (idx=0; idx < node2.cells.length; idx++)

181 {

182 if (idx == col)

183 continue;

184 node = l_id(mach+â€™dirâ€™+idx);

185 if (node != undefined)

186 node.src = â€˜/images/nav/nlempty.gifâ€™;

187 }

188

189 while (true)

190 {

191 node = l_id(mach+â€™rowâ€™+i);

192 if (node != undefined)

193 {

194 // when we are sorting by a different type/value than the cell contiains, that value will

195 // exist in a hidden span - which will always be the first child within the

196 if(sAlternateSortType != null)

197 elem = node.cells[col].firstChild.innerHTML;

198 else

199 elem = node.cells[col].innerHTML;

200 cols = new Array();

201

202 for (idx=0; idx < node.cells.length; idx++)

203 {

204 cols[idx] = node.cells[idx].innerHTML;

205

206 if(node.cells[idx].firstChild && node.cells[idx].firstChild.nodeName == â€˜INPUTâ€™ && node.cells[idx].firstChild.type == â€˜checkboxâ€™)

207 {

208 // If a checkbox is checked now, but was not checked the last time we drew it, add CHECKED to the input tag

209 if(node.cells[idx].firstChild.checked && node.cells[idx].innerHTML.indexOf(â€˜checkedâ€™) < 0)

210 cols[idx] = cols[idx].substring(0,cols[idx].length-1) + â€˜ CHECKED>â€™;

211 // else if a checkbox is NOT checked, but it was when we drew it, remove CHECKED from the input tag

212 else if(!node.cells[idx].firstChild.checked && node.cells[idx].innerHTML.indexOf(â€˜checkedâ€™) >= 0)

213 cols[idx] = cols[idx].substring(0,cols[idx].indexOf(â€˜checkedâ€™)) + â€˜>â€™;

214 }

215

216 }

217

218

219 if (hier)

220 {

221 hierfld = l_elem(â€˜_hierâ€™+i);

222 if (hiercol)

223 elem = hierfld.value;

224 elems[i] = new l_node(elem.toLowerCase(),cols,coltype,dir_up,hierfld.value);

225 }

226 else if (col2 != -1)

227 elems[i] = new l_node(elem.toLowerCase(),cols,coltype,dir_up,null,node.cells[col2].innerHTML,col2type,dir_up2, ordered_mach ? findEncodedValue(mach, mach+â€seqnumâ€, i+1) : -1);

228 else

229 elems[i] = new l_node(elem.toLowerCase(),cols,coltype,dir_up,null,null,null,null,ordered_mach ? findEncodedValue(mach, mach+â€seqnumâ€, i+1) : -1);

230 i++;

231 }

232 else

233 break;

234 }

235

236 numRows = i;

237 i = 0;

238

239 elems.sort(l_sortnodes);

240

241 while (i < numRows)

242 {

243 node = l_id(mach+â€™rowâ€™+i);

244 rnode = elems[i];

245 cols = rnode.row;

246

247 for (idx=0; idx < node.cells.length; idx++)

248 node.cells[idx].innerHTML = cols[idx];

249

250 if (hier)

251 {

252 hierfld = l_elem(â€˜_hierâ€™+i);

253 hierfld.value = rnode.hier;

254 }

255 if (ordered_mach)

256 setEncodedValue(mach,rnode.linenum,mach+â€™seqnumâ€™,i+1);

257 i++;

258 }

259 l_saveprefs(mach, col, colname, coltype, dir_up);

260}

261

262function l_sortprefs(col,coltype,mach,colname)

263{

264 var dir_up = true;

265 node = l_id(mach+â€™dirâ€™+col);

266 if (node.src.indexOf(â€˜nlup.gifâ€™) != -1)

267 dir_up = false;

268 l_saveprefs(mach, col, colname, coltype, dir_up);

269}

nlapiDateToString(new Date())new Date() å¯ä»¥å¾—åˆ°å½“å‰æ—¥æœŸ.var cur_time = (new Date()).getTime(); è·å–å½“å‰æ—¶é—´.â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”Example 1The following example uses nlapiTransformRecord to creâ€¦

Example 1

The following example uses nlapiTransformRecord to create an Item Fulfillment record from an existing Sales Order record.

var itemfulfillment = nlapiTransformRecord(â€˜salesorderâ€™, 1500, â€˜itemfulfillmentâ€™)

itemfulfillment.setFieldValue(â€˜trandateâ€™, nlapiDateToString(new Date()) )

Example 2

The next script shows how to create an Item Receipt record from a Purchase Order.

function trans()

{

var fromrecord;

var fromid;

var torecord;

var trecord;

var qty;

fromrecord = â€˜purchaseorderâ€™;

fromid = 26 ; // Transform PO with ID = 26 ;

torecord = â€˜itemreceiptâ€™;

// Transaform a record with given id to a different record type.

// For example - from PO to Item Receipt

// Get the object of the transformed record.

trecord = nlapiTransformRecord(fromrecord, fromid, torecord,true);

qty = trecord.getLineItemValue(â€˜itemâ€™, â€˜quantityâ€™, 1 );

trecord.setLineItemValue(â€˜itemâ€™, â€˜quantityâ€™, 1, â€˜2â€™ );

var idl = nlapiSubmitRecord(trecord, true);

nlapiSendEmail(-5, -5, â€˜Transform Emailâ€™ + â€˜Original Qty =

â€˜ + qty + â€˜ â€˜ + â€˜Record Created = â€˜ + idl , null);

}

Example 3

The following script shows how to create a Build item record from an Assembly record.

/* Assembly item Name = Computer and Id = 328

Location Name = West and Id = 3 // When Multi Location inventory is enabled

2 Member components of Assembly item

Member 1 Name = CPU - Quantity = 2

Member 2 Name = Memory - Quantity = 4

*/

function transformtest1()

{

var fromRecord = â€˜assemblyitemâ€™;

var fromId = 328;

var toRecord = â€˜buildâ€™;

var defaultV = new Array();

defaultV.quantity =1; // Default quantity to build

defaultV.location =â€™3â€™; // Default location id

var record = nlapiTransformRecord(fromRecord, fromId, toRecord, defaultV);

var id = nlapiSubmitRecord(record, false);

}

entry.title: é€šè¿‡Performancing for Firefoxå‘å¸ƒBlog - åšå®¢å›­-CarlZeng
entry.content:
Thank you for contacting NetSuite Customer Support regarding creating a custom record type/list similar to the Address tab.
Â 
I found that it is not possible using normal customization. To workaround that, you may just create custom record types (Setup > Customization > Record Types) and display them in the tabs of the record where you want to see them.
Â 
I hope this information is useful to you. If you have further concerns or questions on this, just email back or call into the toll-free number to re-open this case.
Â 
Thank you and have a good day! Â 

Thank you,

Olivia Dy

Thank you for contacting NetSuite Customer Support regarding creating a custom record type/list similar to the Address tab.
Â 
I found that it is not possible using normal customization. To workaround that, you may just create custom record types (Setup > Customization > Record Types) and display them in the tabs of the record where you want to see them.
Â 
I hope this information is useful to you. If you have further concerns or questions on this, just email back or call into the toll-free number to re-open this case.
Â 
Thank you and have a good day! Â 

Thank you,

Olivia Dy
